Crime_Name: Failure to comply with immigration requirements
Legal_Issue: Did the officer correctly apply the law when rejecting the applicant's PRRA application?
Evidence_Assessment: Only new evidence arising after rejection or previously unavailable can be considered
Decision_Outcome: Officer's decision was reasonable and aligned with legal standards
Legal_Rule: Under subsection 113(a) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, only new evidence arising after rejection or previously unavailable can be considered.
Outcome_on_Merits: No risk of harm was proven
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant's fear of persecution, availability of state protection, internal flight alternative
Applicant_Challenge: Rejection of PRRA application due to insufficient new evidence
Court_Result: Judicial review dismissed; applicant must return to Mexico
Legal_Rule_Source: Subsection 113(a), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Type: New evidence related to fear of persecution
Remedy_Requested: Acceptance of PRRA application, relief from removal
Remedy_Sought: Stay of removal, acceptance of PRRA
Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant, overstayed visa holder
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Overstaying visa, lack of new evidence for PRRA

Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA officer erred in rejecting the applicant's claim based on available evidence and internal flight alternative (IFA)
Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visa, claimed fear of daughter’s father, mother later gained refugee status
Remedy_Requested: Acceptance of PRRA application, relief from removal
Court_Ruling: No error found in PRRA officer's decision
Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant, overstayed visa holder
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution by daughter’s father
Legal_Standard: IFA test: no serious persecution risk and reasonable relocation conditions
Assessment_Factor: Existence of internal flight alternative, credibility of new evidence
Credibility_Assessment: New evidence not deemed credible or newly emerged
Evidence_Used: Mother’s refugee status, details of family situation
Application_Basis: Subsequent PRRA based on familial risk and new circumstances
Evidence_Assessed: Most evidence rejected as not new
Relief_Sought: Stay of removal, acceptance of PRRA
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of new or compelling evidence
Cause_Description: Overstay of visa, failed refugee claims, subsequent PRRA
Evidence_Handling: New evidence evaluated but found insufficient
Decision_Rationale: IFA exists, state protection available, no new evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Evidence not newly arisen or previously unavailable
